reviews.review_msg: Eng 115 Susan Brooks is a very good professor. Her lectures are very interesting and engaging. Course material was very good and I really enjoyed the required novels. Two weeks was given to each novel study and it was plenty of time. My TA was good at engaging the students in tutorial but her marking was extremely harsh.

Susan was a person who reiterated many of the ideas that were blatantly stated in the novel. Her lectures were very abstract and anything said in-class was not allowed to be used for your essays. She limits you on what you can write and the TAs were horrible. Essays were marked extremely hard with no real rubric! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! GPA KILLER

She is definitely a great person, very understanding and kind. She is a little but "different" but hey, thats always a little bit fun. Despite being a good person her lectures are SO LONG & boring, many absolutely dread them

Honestly such a great prof. Very passionate about everything he talks about and gave us insightful knowledge about the material. If anything, he made us read 1 novel every 2 weeks, so there is ALOT of reading to get through by the end of the semester. I however was able to survive by skimming and using spark notes. Exams fair, just know the books.
